description: Master index of all structured data in the PrimalMyst Books

character.description: Character entries including NPCs, protagonists, and historical figures

location.description: Locations including cities, dungeons, natural areas, and structures

timeline-event.description: Historical events that shaped the world

lore.description: Deep world knowledge including cosmology, mythology, and magic systems

league.description: League mechanics and world types defining different gameplay experiences

damage-type.description: Damage types and combat mechanics including elemental and primal categories

divine-trio.description: Divine trio lore files containing detailed information about competing divine forces

subcategories.cosmology: Six Realms, Yggdrasil, and divine structure
subcategories.geography: World geography, island realms, and physical manifestations
subcategories.divine-hierarchy: Fundamental Gods, Primal Gods, and Veiled Ones
subcategories.mystical-arts: Mist-working, Paths of Mastery, and skill-based systems
subcategories.cosmic-cycles: Great Cycles, cosmic rhythms, and Myrielle's guidance
subcategories.mythology: Creation myths, divine stories, and ancient wisdom

subcategories.current: Active seasonal leagues with temporary content
subcategories.offline-eternal: Offline permanent leagues for solo play

subcategories.elemental: Fire, cold, and lightning damage types
subcategories.primal: Holy, chaos, and physical damage types

relationships.character_to_location: Characters have origin and current locations
relationships.character_to_character: Characters have relationships with each other
relationships.character_to_lore: Characters embody or are related to lore concepts
relationships.location_to_location: Locations can contain or connect to other locations
relationships.location_to_lore: Locations may have mythological or magical significance
relationships.event_to_event: Events can be preceded or followed by other events
relationships.event_to_lore: Events may fulfill prophecies or embody lore concepts
relationships.lore_to_lore: Lore entries can reference and build upon each other

guidelines: Use descriptive names that clearly identify the entity
Include titles or epithets for important characters
Use 'the-' prefix for unique locations and events
Keep IDs reasonably short but unambiguous

new_content: 1. Choose appropriate schema (character, location, timeline-event, lore)
2. Create unique ID following naming conventions
3. Fill required fields according to schema
6. Create or update corresponding narrative documentation
7. Update this index if adding new categories
updates: 1. Modify JSON data maintaining schema compliance
6. Run consistency checks across affected content

game_systems.character_stats: JSON character data can populate game character sheets
game_systems.location_data: Location JSON provides world map and area information
game_systems.quest_integration: Timeline events can trigger or reference game quests
game_systems.lore_systems: In-game codex can pull from lore JSON entries

tome_display.dynamic_pages: JSON data can generate tome pages automatically
tome_display.search_indexing: Tags and descriptions enable full-text search
tome_display.timeline_views: Event data can generate interactive timelines

community_tools.contribution_forms: Schemas can generate input forms for community content
community_tools.validation_tools: Schema validation can check community submissions
community_tools.content_management: JSON structure enables programmatic content organization

expansion_guidelines.new_schemas: Only add new schemas for fundamentally different content types
expansion_guidelines.schema_updates: Use semantic versioning and backward compatibility when possible
expansion_guidelines.data_migration: Provide migration tools when schema changes break existing data
expansion_guidelines.documentation: Update this index and all related documentation when making changes
